title: Psychosocial Disability & Mental Wellbeing
summary: Calm, practical support for mental health and psychosocial disability — with clear steps and support at your pace.
bullets: Support with daily routines and planning
Step-by-step support to reach personal goals
Support with coping strategies and wellbeing routines
Support for families and carers (with consent)

faqs.q: Can you support people with anxiety or depression?
faqs.a: Yes. We provide calm, respectful support and work at your pace. We can start small and build confidence over time.

faqs.q: Do you provide counselling or therapy?
faqs.a: We are not a clinical therapy service. We provide practical NDIS supports that help with routines, confidence, and daily life.

title: Personal Care & Daily Living Support
summary: Warm, respectful support with personal tasks so you can live safely and comfortably.
bullets: Support at home and in the community

faqs.q: Do you support participants with complex needs?
faqs.a: We can support many needs. If you have higher support requirements, contact us so we can confirm the right staff and approach for safe support.

faqs.q: Can supports happen at home or in the community?
faqs.a: Yes. Supports can be provided at home and/or out in the community depending on your goals and plan.

title: In-Home Support & Household Tasks
summary: Practical help at home to keep routines running smoothly and your space comfortable.
bullets: Support to maintain a safe living environment

faqs.q: What household tasks can you help with?
faqs.a: We can assist with common daily household tasks like meals, cleaning, laundry, and keeping your home safe and organised.
We focus on everyday household support. If you need specialist cleaning, we can discuss what’s possible and what may need an external provider.

title: Social & Community Participation
summary: Support to get out and about, enjoy activities, and build confidence in the community.

faqs.a: Yes. We plan activities around your interests and goals, and we keep communication clear and simple.

faqs.q: Do you support people with anxiety in the community?
faqs.a: Yes. We go at your pace and can start with shorter outings, gradually building confidence.

title: Transport Support
summary: Safe transport assistance so you can get to appointments, activities, and daily errands.

faqs.q: Do you provide transport and support together?
faqs.a: Yes. We can provide transport and stay with you for the activity or appointment if that’s what you need.

faqs.q: Can you support public transport training?
faqs.a: Yes. We can help you build skills and confidence using buses, trains, and other transport options.

title: Capacity Building & Life Skills
summary: Support to build independence with everyday skills—at your pace, in a way that works for you.

faqs.a: We keep it simple: we talk about what matters to you, choose small steps, and review progress regularly.
Yes. With your consent, we can include families/support people to keep supports consistent.

title: Support Coordination (when available)
summary: Help understanding and using your NDIS plan, connecting with services that match your goals.
note: Optional service: available depending on staffing and participant needs.

faqs.a: Not always. Availability depends on staffing and participant needs. Contact us and we’ll confirm.

faqs.q: Can you help me understand my plan?
faqs.a: Yes. We can explain supports clearly and help you take the next steps.

title: Day Programs (Coming Soon)
summary: Group activities in a welcoming environment—available as we grow and expand our supports.
note: Coming soon: we plan to introduce day programs once we are registered and have enough participants.

faqs.a: As we grow and expand. We’ll update the website once dates and availability are confirmed.
